meanings.definition: To fly or rise high in the air
meanings.sent1: Birds soar gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Eagles soar effortlessly above the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The kite was so light that it could soar with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits soar like a bird set free.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon began to soar towards the clouds.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in amount or value
meanings.sent1: Stock prices soar after positive news.
meanings.sent2: The demand for the product soared unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: Her excitement soared when she heard the good news.
meanings.sent4: The temperature soared to record levels in the summer heat.
meanings.sent5: The popularity of the band began to soar after their hit song.

meanings.definition: To rise or ascend to a great height
meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon started to soar into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The rocket soared towards outer space.
meanings.sent3: His imagination soared as he read the adventure book.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper seemed to soar above the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The mountain climber felt his spirits soar as he reached the summit.
